CatDescriptText: Otis Guest, chauffeur, Shadyside and Mr. Demmie Prichett, steelwoker, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 17, 1960, pg. 11A with question: "Do you think Negroes choose their own leaders or are they chosen for them by someone else?" Mr. Guest's answer reads: "They should but I don't think they do.  They let other people speak for them.  The reason is because although we are educated, well educated in many cases, we really haven't go together like other groups."  Mr. Prichett's answer reads: "I think we should choose our own leaders but we don't, and the reason why is, because we have only a few real good leaders."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Otis Guest wearing necktie and hat with brim and strip of caning, standing in front of swirled granite tiled wall, Wood Street, Downtown; Portrait of Demmie Prichett wearing textured button down shirt and tweed cap, standing in front of swirled granite tiled wall, Wood Street, Downtown
